intro: Aphyllon californicum subsp. jepsonii, commonly known as the Jepson's aphyllon, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are alternate and generally reduced, with a hairy texture. It is native to California and is adapted to the region's Mediterranean climate.
